title: Fire Victims Say PG&E Ignored Them While Negotiating Bankruptcy Plan
text:
Victims of the 2017-18 California wildfires threw their support behind a plan that hands control of PG&E Corp. to its bondholders because of their poor treatment at the hands of the big utility, a lawyer for fire victims said Tuesday.

Speaking at a hearing in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in San Francisco, victims’ lawyer Cecily Dumas said PG&E, which has been lobbying lawmakers in the state capital and courting Wall Street investors, had “zero” meetings with the people whose damage claims from wildfires tied to the utility’s...
